title: "Gene Expression Matrix Practice"
output: html_notebook

```{r}
# Set a "seed" so we get the same random numbers every time we run this
set.seed(42) 

# Create the data
# sample(1:100, 50) picks 50 random numbers between 1 and 100
expression_data <- matrix(sample(1:100, 50), nrow = 5, ncol = 10)

# Define the column names
colnames(expression_data) <- c("cond1", "cond2", "cond3", "cond4", "cond5", 
                               "ctrl1", "ctrl2", "ctrl3", "ctrl4", "ctrl5")

# Define the row names
rownames(expression_data) <- c("gene1", "gene2", "gene3", "gene4", "gene5")

# 1. Calculate the average of the 5 condition columns (Columns 1 to 5)
# rowMeans() calculates the average for every row automatically
cond_means <- rowMeans(expression_data[, 1:5])

# 2. Calculate the average of the 5 control columns (Columns 6 to 10)
ctrl_means <- rowMeans(expression_data[, 6:10])

# 3. Calculate Fold Change
fold_change <- cond_means / ctrl_means

# Create a clean results table
results <- data.frame(
  Condition_Avg = cond_means,
  Control_Avg = ctrl_means,
  Fold_Change = fold_change
)

# Display the final results
print(results)
